titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: left after breakfast. I motored to Pembridge, where a celebration of Holy Communion had been arranged in connexion with the Rector's funeral. I celebrated & was assisted by the Rural Dean and
. The brilliance of the autumnal colouring was wonderful, but there is the nip of winter in the air. I attended the meeting of the Board of Finance. We choice [sic]
to be paid secretary. He has an engaging candour of aspect & manner, which ought to commend him to the clergy & churchwardens.
a copy of my Strike–sermon. He writes in terms of high appreciation.
It is grimly suggestive that I win only the approbation of octogenarians
! I suppose it is the case that I am really one of their contemporaries.
This must be an enormous handicap when, as needs must be, I come into any public discussion. For I am plainly archaic &, at best, only half intelligible. Yet what help is there
Few things are more ludicrous, & none more futile than for the aged to simulate youth
!! Moreover there seem to be no fixed & recognizable principles in this new "Liberalism", which I can discern & try to accept!
